results.title: Training for development
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the practical assistance given to several students from developing countries by the Australian Development Assistance Bureau. The students are given short practical courses designed to meet the needs of the government.

results.title: Training dogs: the Woodhouse way
results.brief_description: Dogs can be a problem. Whether puppies or fully grown, they can give owners a lot of trouble if they are not properly trained. How do you cope with a young puppy and prevent puddles in the hall? How do you deal with an adult dog pulling on the lead, jumping at people or terrified of traffic? Barbara Woodhouse’s tackles fundamental problems of obedience facing new dog owners and provides strategies to overcome them. Mrs Woodhouse takes untrained dogs of different breeds and shows how dog and owner can quickly become a happy team.

results.title: Training day [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Village Roadshow Pictures, Warner Bros Pictures, NPV Entertainment, Jeffrey Silver, Bobby Newmyer and Antoine Fuqua
results.brief_description: It takes weeks to prove yourself when starting a new job. Unfortunately, rookie policeman Jake Hoyt has one day to prove himself to Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, head of the L.A. Police Department narcotic squad. Harris has a reputation for being the best, and Hoyt is eager to impress him on the ride-along. However, Hoyt soon discovers that Detective Sergeant Harris makes his own rules, becoming violent when his street-justice methods are questioned. Battling with his own morals, Hoyt soon realises that there is more to Harris than meets the eye, and soon realises that his first day at work may also be his last. Denzel Washington won the Best Actor in a Leading Role Academy Award in 2002 for his role as the corrupt Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, while Ethan Hawke (Jake Hoyt) was nominated for the Best Actor in a Supporting Role. Cast also includes Tom Berenger, Scott Glenn and musicians Snoop Dogg, Dr. Dre and Macy Gray.

results.title: Training champions
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Jack S. Allan and Richard Mason
results.brief_description: The methods used by well known Australian coaches including Frank Guthrie, Harry Gallagher and Forbes Carlyle in training present and future swimming champions. Underwater photography is used to show the action of Lorraine Crapp, David Thiele and Murray Rose.

results.title: Training a navy
results.brief_description: An information film on the Royal Australian Navy’s main shore training establishment, HMAS Cerberus at Westernport, Victoria. It shows recruits undergoing basic and advanced training, the general routine at Cerberus, and sporting and recreational activities.

results.title: Trained to serve
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit, Kosmos Film Produktion and Graham Wallace
results.brief_description: One of a series of film designed to show the rest of the world the problems facing the Control Commission of the Western Zone of occupied Germany. This film deals with the forming and running of a new German police force. Against flashes of the past, when the police were a terror to every citizen, the promotion of a new police force under British and American guidance is traced.

results.title: Train time
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and John Shearman
results.brief_description: An account of the operation of British Railways. The integration of goods and passenger services calls for a constant review of time-tables to meet the varying local needs. A sudden demand for extra locomotives in West Cornwall may effect tin plate traffic from South Wales and fish from Scottish ports rushed to the markets potentially affects rail demands in the Midlands. Shows how coal wagons are sorted in Toton Marshalling Yard and how London’s evening rush to the suburbs is dealt with. Music composed by Edward Williams.

results.title: Tragedy or triumph
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Edward Magruder Jones and Krishna Singh
results.brief_description: At the World Food Conference in 1974, the international community assessed the dimensions of the world food crisis and attempted to mobilise support for specific programs to head off disaster. The film surveys the causes of the present world food situation and identifies some of the measures which could increase food production.
